reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Hydrates and soothes skin for a soft glow.
reviews.reviewText: This mask is the perfect pick me up if you are tired or had a lack sleep. I like to put it on before work or meeting friends. It’s really soothing & hydrates your skin. I have oily skin and have really enjoyed the benefits from this mask.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Only sheet mask you'll ever need.
reviews.reviewText: Love, love, loveIf you have sensitive skin, dry skin, oily skin or combination this product is for you. This is the best sheet mask I've ever tired and for sure my go to.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Soft, sheer, soothing!
reviews.reviewText: These sheer yet strong masks are soft enough to pay flat on your face. I used one after getting a little too much sun and I could immediately feel my sunburned face feeling soothed and cool. When I took it off my skin looked and felt great!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best Face Mask
reviews.reviewText: This is the best face mask I have ever used. The aloe in it makes your skin so soft and the smell is so relaxing. Great product!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Improves skin look and feel
reviews.reviewText: Been using it for 6 months now. Wonderful product. My skin feels amazingly smoother and the dullness has disappeared. Definitely helps in clarifying my skin appearance .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2017
reviews.reviewText: I am sort of new to sheet masking...having tried about a dozen different brands over the past six months. That said, I have been masking (traditionally applied with a brush or fingers) since I was 13 (am now in mid 40's). I know what my skin likes: goopy soothing masks that deliver hydration and reduce redness and hyperpigmentation. I know what my skin hates: perfumes, alcohol, astringents, anything *minty* and coarse/grainy textures.I bought this mask looking for something to hydrate and help with stubborn hyperpigmentation as a regular use mask...not an occasional heavy-lifter/special duty sort of mask. I will be honest and state that I would NOT have purchased this at full price ($30?). Luckily I found it at TJ MAXX for $8.00/4 (so $2/ea). The lot # was 001. Gave it a go based on the positive reviews posted here on amazon and elsewhere on the internet.Initial thoughts, the mask was somewhat difficult to unfold and did not come with a backing like many other sheet masks I have tried. It did feel substantial. similar in thickness to the more expensive masks I have splurged on. The serum was abundant but wasn't overly drippy (happy about this!). Once applied, the fit was fairly decent on my face. The serum felt cooling and soothing. I did not experience any stinging or irritation or notice heavy perfume or fragrance. Happily, the mask was comfortable to wear and didn't slip and slide on my face during treatment. Although the instructions indicate the effective time of this mask is 5-10 min, I was distracted and didn't end up removing it until 20 min later. Whoops! The mask was mostly dry by this point, possibly indicating the absorption rate was good. Serum remaining on my skin was absorbed within 5 min after removal.After masking, my skin felt tingly and cool. I noticed initial minor changes to the darkened areas on my forehead and cheeks and did see some small improvement (plumping?) of the fine lines age has blessed me with. My pores appeared smaller. My skin felt very smooth.I found this mask to be adequately hydrating for an early fall day (65 degrees / 54% humidity). Not sure how it would hold up in the dead of winter on super dry skin. Will post an update once we get to snow season.I liked this better than the Creme Shop Rose and Jeju Green Tea masks but not as much as the Karuna Brightening mask (all time fave so far). I aspire to sheet mask more often (daily?) and so I can see this fitting into my routine quite well as an every other day sort of brightening mask, provided I can continue to source it at an affordable price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great, soothing mask!
reviews.reviewText: These masks are amazing! My skin feels smoother and more hydrated. And, it did wonders in such little time!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2021
reviews.reviewText: Have used them before leaves face soft and hydrated

reviews.reviewTitle: Where are the other 4 masks? I only got 1!!
reviews.reviewText: Not sure where the other 4 masks are but I paid $39.55 for 1 mask, no box, just 1 sheet mask...not advertised properly!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 28, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: Seriously the best beauty secret. Treat yo’self.
reviews.reviewText: A friend gave me one of these and I became addicted. Thwy’rw expensive, yet, but isn’t the skin on our face worth some pampering?My skin never felt so good as it does after using one of these amazing sheet masks!! I also pour out all the extra serum into my hands and rub it along my arms to get extra soft skin! 😊

These are NOT as asvertised and are not like the Patchology masks I have purchased previously!! Different package and slightly different ingredients and only 4 masks (vs. 5 that are advertised on the box!). Very dissappointed.
